derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from late Latin extensio(n-), from extendere 'stretch out' (see extend)

entry.def: An extension is a new room or building which is added to an existing building or group of buildings.
An extension is a new section of a road or rail line that is added to an existing road or line.
An extension is an extra period of time for which something lasts or is valid, usually as a result of official permission.

example.ex: He first entered Britain on a six-month visa, and was given a further extension of six months...
example.tran: 他最初持6个月的签证进入英国，后来又获得6个月的续签。

example.ex: Ian Lentern has been granted a three-year extension.
example.tran: 伊恩·伦特恩已经被批准延期3年。

entry.def: Something that is an extension of something else is a development of it that includes or affects more people, things, or activities.

example.ex: Many Filipinos see the bases as an extension of American colonial rule...
example.tran: 很多菲律宾人视这些基地为美国殖民统治的延续。

example.ex: That's the logical extension of my approach.
example.tran: 那是对我的方法的合乎逻辑的扩展。

entry.tran: 电话分机（亦用书面缩略ext.）
entry.def: An extension is a telephone line that is connected to the switchboard of a company or institution, and that has its own number. The written abbreviation ext. is also used.

example.ex: She can get me on extension 308...
example.tran: 她打308分机就能联系到我。

example.ex: For further information, please contact 414 3925, extension 2253.

entry.def: An extension is a part which is connected to a piece of equipment in order to make it reach something further away.

example.ex: Some of the best extensions are made from sections of rod tube or drainpipe.
example.tran: 最好的延长管中有些是用杆管或排水管制成的。

means.word_mean: 1. a mutually agreed delay in the date set for the completion of a job or payment of a debt;

sentences.sentence: "they applied for an extension of the loan"

means.word_mean: 2. act of expanding in scope; making more widely available;

sentences.sentence: "extension of the program to all in need"

means.word_mean: 3. the spreading of something (a belief or practice) into new regions
4. an educational opportunity provided by colleges and universities to people who not enrolled as regular students
5. act of stretching or straightening out a flexed limb
6. a string of characters beginning with a period and followed by one to three letters; the optional second part of a PC computer filename;

sentences.sentence: "most applications provide extensions for the files they create"
"most BASIC files use the filename extension .BAS"

means.word_mean: 7. the most direct or specific meaning of a word or expression; the class of objects that an expression refers to;

sentences.sentence: "the extension of `satellite of Mars' is the set containing only Demos and Phobos"

means.word_mean: 8. the ability to raise the working leg high in the air;

sentences.sentence: "the dancer was praised for her uncanny extension"
"good extension comes from a combination of training and native ability"

means.word_mean: 9. amount or degree or range to which something extends;

sentences.sentence: "the wire has an extension of 50 feet"

means.word_mean: 10. an additional telephone set that is connected to the same telephone line
11. an addition to the length of something
12. an addition that extends a main building

stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出+tens伸展,趋向+ive……的→伸出去的→广大的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 强烈的,剧烈的;热烈的,热情的
stems_affixes.word_buile: in加强+tens伸展,趋向+e→拉紧→强烈的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 强烈的, 精深的, 透彻的
stems_affixes.word_buile: intense[adj.强烈的,剧烈的;热烈的,热情的]+ive表形容词→adj.强烈的, 精深的, 透彻的
tens伸展,趋向+e→adj.紧张的, 拉紧的 v.[使]紧张,[使]拉紧
tens伸展,趋向+ible能……的→adj.可伸长的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可拉长的, 可伸长的
stems_affixes.word_buile: tens伸展,趋向+ile表形容词→adj.可拉长的, 可伸长的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 延长;扩大;范围;大小;尺寸;电话分机
stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出+tens伸展,趋向+ion表名词→伸出去→扩张

stems_affixes.value_cn: 强烈, 剧烈, 强度;亮度
stems_affixes.word_buile: intense[adj.强烈的,剧烈的;热烈的,热情的]+ity表名词→n.强烈, 剧烈, 强度;亮度
pre前+tens伸展,趋向+ion表名词→提前摆出一种姿态→自负
tens伸展,趋向+ion表名词→伸展出的状态→紧张
tens伸展,趋向+ity表名词→n.紧张, 紧张度

stems_affixes.value_cn: 加强; 变强; 加剧
stems_affixes.word_buile: intense[adj.强烈的,剧烈的;热烈的,热情的]+ify……化→v.加强; 变强; 加剧
tens伸展,趋向+e→adj.紧张的, 拉紧的 v.[使]紧张,[使]拉紧
